name: Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church et al., Appellants, v. Harrisburg City Council
name_abbreviation: Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church v. Harrisburg City Council

judges: Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
parties: Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church et al., Appellants, v. Harrisburg City Council.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Cueiam,
The order of this Court heretofore entered on August 9, 1971, granting appellants’ petition for allowance of appeal is vacated as improvidently granted.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell and Mr. Justice Baebieei took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Pee Cueiam,

attorneys: Joseph Q. Manta, with him Peter J. Ressler, Nabors é Ressler, and LaBrum and Book, for appellant.
Edward W. Rothman, Assistant City Solicitor, and Rod J. Pera, with them McNees, Wallace & Nurick for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church et al., Appellants, v. Harrisburg City Council.
Argued November 15, 1971.
Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
reargument refused February 14, 1972.
Joseph Q. Manta, with him Peter J. Ressler, Nabors é Ressler, and LaBrum and Book, for appellant.
Edward W. Rothman, Assistant City Solicitor, and Rod J. Pera, with them McNees, Wallace & Nurick for appellees.
December 20, 1971:
